page.title: 06TYPES OF FARMS
page.content: Arable farms predominate. The main crops being wheat, barley and oilseed rape. There has been an increase in the amount of fertiliser used so as to produce optimum yields. The use of insecticides has been kept down by using crop rotation as a way of avoiding disease. Silage is produced by those farms with cattle: they are grazed on fields near the river. There is one outdoor pig unit which reflects the changing methods of modern farming as units of this type have only been developed during the last twenty years. EEC regulations have reduced cereal prices but local farmers have been fortunate with milk quotas. Wet weather in June this year, which flattened barley and spoilt much of the hay, is thought to have had more effect than the Common Market.
